forgottenPassword.title: Reset Password

home.carouBonn: A candidate had no objections, he/she was elected. Will he/she accept his position?
home.carouCeleb: A candidate was finally elected, well done! You can celebrate this.
home.carouObj: A candidate has been nominated, do you have any objections concerning his election?
home.carouReport: You can change your vote after consulting the other votes and their arguments.
home.endExp: If no objection is raised during the objection phase, the participant will be elected. Otherwise, another participant will be nominated.
home.introText1: The principle of elections without candidates, resulting from the sociocracy, makes it possible to decide in consent who will take responsibility for a role, position or function.
home.introText2: This method also allows to choose from multiple options concerning a nomination.
home.introText3: It is, like decision-making, a rigorous multi-step process.
home.introText4: Elections without candidates are also a way to bond, to update certain hidden conflicts,
home.introText5: to support and to encourage participants to take their place within
home.introText6: the circle and nourish our need for recognition.
home.introText7: In an election without candidates we vote "With" and never "For or Against".
home.objectionExp1: A phase of objections. After the concluded votes, a participant will be nomitated amongst all the participants having received at least one vote.
home.objectionExp2: You can thus raise certain objections, if you have any, to this participant being elected.
home.reportExp1: A vote postponement phase. After having voted, you will be able to consult the votes of the other participants,
home.reportExp2: and you will have a time window to modify your vote if you wish.
home.subtitle: An election without candidates breaks down into several phases :
home.voteExp: A voting phase. Everyone votes for the participant they want, and explain their vote.
